_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
2/14/26 5:30 AM Update:  
Gooood morning Crystal Mountain! Mighty Tahoma blessed us with a snowy kiss last night to set the mood for a powdery Valentines Day! This was just a peck so you'll have to wait a wee bit longer for any waist deep turns. Expect groomers to be ripping and the off piste to have a playful dusting on top of crust, with potentially deeper pockets waiting for those willing to work for them. Drive safe and don't pass when you shouldn't!
Game plan:  
  • Find the groomed runs that cat crew did early in the evening and you will be a happy camper

Events: Join us tomorrow for Love Gondola from 2-4pm on Saturday February 14th. Let the mountains play matchmaker! Whether you're looking for a ski buddy or hoping to find love at 6,872 feet, hop on the Love Gondola and see where the ride takes you. Stick around for our Apres Is for Lovers from 3-5pm. Toast to romance while enjoying the serene alpine ambiance and cozy aprs atmosphere.  

Note: The Mt. Rainier Gondola is available for downloading! With variable conditions through Lucky Shot, dont force it if you're second guessing the terrain. Take the scenic ride down and keep it smooth out there.

The Discovery Park and Arwine's Jump Line are open today! 

Notes for today:
  1. The Summit House will be closed all day on the13th and 19th of February.
  2. Campbell Basin will be open today 2/13 with grab-and-go, snacks and for restroom use. 
  3. Night Skiing hours have been adjusted to 4pm to 7pm. Night Skiing has been cancelled for the following dates: 2/16, 2/17, and 2/18. 
  4. Weve made the decision to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  5. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation, and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  6. $62 Day tickets continue every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  7. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  8. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Offered on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift quicker and more laps faster. 
  9. Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact center cannot process these cancellations.
  10. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 2/13/2026 4:10pm 

Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: A low-pressure system aimed at California has inched slightly further north, increasing our expected snow totals for the next 24 hr period. While this still is not the most powerful storm in the world, we can expect to get 2-4 of snow overnight and potentially some more lingering showers during the day on Saturday. With cold temps and light winds, this should make for some really fun skiing come Saturday morning. After a dry spell like this, 4 inches has never felt so good, happy Valentine's Day folks. 

Friday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 4,000
12hr Precip: 2-4 possible
Wind Trends: Light to Moderate Southwest
Saturday: 
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 4,500
12hr Precip: Trace amounts possible
Wind Trends: Light Southwest 
Saturday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 4,000
12hr Precip: Trace amounts possible
Wind Trends: Light to Northeast

Outlook: The Northwest trickle is in full effect for the next couple of days. No single storm is looking particularly powerful, but we should remain in consistent light showers with cold temps well into the extended forecast. This is likely not enough snow to expand into closed terrain, but it should make the open terrain quite fun to ski. 




Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card, this must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, bottom of Chinook, bottom of Discovery, and top of Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS,CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find your right fit.
  • Freeride Program (NEW! Adult Programs now available): Registration now open, limited spots available! 
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on mountain storage with limited availability, lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or the entire family, check out options today .
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
Gold Hills and Northway will remain closed due to snow conditions.

Uphill Travel Status: PERMITTED. Uphill Travel is only permitted up the standard route up the Meadow and Quicksilver. Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.
